reviews.text: High quality ingredients used in food, enjoyed every part of my meal thoroughly. Service was a bit slow. Overall really great experience.
The real deal. Fresh and fantastic. The chef clearly knows what he is doing. Well worth it!

Really affordable, came for lunch. The dip is great for groups but could have done without. Couldnâ€™t taste the crab dip that well. The calamari was sucha great deal and large portions. Good crisp, wish we had a touch more lemon. The Branzino was the star, good portions. All for about 100
Chill spot

The food is excellent â€” you even get a dessert after the main course.

The restaurant itself feels a bit crowded, but that also shows how popular it is.

Unfortunately, there arenâ€™t enough restrooms for a place of this size.

One more note: the lady at the entrance in charge of table assignments could be a bit friendlier.
Beautiful tasty good!  A place you can't miss! Crowded.
One of the best calamari Iâ€™ve ever had â€” super fresh! The wait was pretty long, but definitely worth it. Service couldâ€™ve been a bit better though.

!! BIGGER IS NOT ALWAYS BETTER HONEY !!

So Taverna Kyclades used to be on Ditmars between 33rd and 35th Street.. small, cozy, and family-oriented. Sure, it was tight, but it felt like sitting down in someoneâ€™s Greek grandmaâ€™s living room. You had to fight for a reservation, but honestly, that was part of the charm.
Now?? They moved to a corner spot on Ditmars and 36th. Youâ€™d think â€œnew, bigger, better!â€
WRONG.
Instead, they plopped this wholesome family restaurant right into club central, literally across from Tru Astoria (which, btw, is basically a club that pretends itâ€™s a restaurantâ€¦ story for another day). So instead of a chill family vibe, youâ€™re now dining with car horns, drunk laughter, and bass from across the street.
And letâ€™s talk about the menu: half the items donâ€™t even have prices listed. Likeâ€¦ am I at a restaurant or Sothebyâ€™s?

PRO TIP: bring a fat wallet, because friends of mine have dropped $200 on one fish. ONE. FISH. Honey, for $200 that fish better sing me a song and tuck me into bed at night. Meanwhile, you could literally walk to any Astoria fish market, grab the same type of fish, season it, toss it in the oven, and call it a day for $30.
Now, not everythingâ€™s bad, the calamari is AWESOME. And I take my calamari very seriously. Itâ€™s the one dish every seafood place should get right, and thank Poseidon, they nailed it.
So yeah, if you go, read the menu beforehand, brace your wallet, and maybe bring earplugs. Itâ€™s not bad, but it definitely isnâ€™t the cozy little spot it once was.

Most important thing they get absolutely right here is the food. We ordered the octopus, lamp chops, slouvaki, and couple of sides for three people. So much food! We were thrilled with what arrived. Octopus also tends to be my litmus test for a great restaurant with seafood speciality. They hit it out of the park. Fantastic. Portions leave you well fed and they even have very nice mixes for non alcohol drinks using herbs and ginger. Love it. I highly recommend this place. Nights out are meant to be special and this dinner was memorable. Staff was gracious and sat us without any fuss as walk in on a busy night. Will definitely return.
The food was delicious and the atmosphere is great!

we finally checked this place out with much anticipation since there are always long lines but the food is sooo mediocre and tastes slightly off. youâ€™re so much better off at the plethora of other amazing seafood places in astoria (elias corner, astoria seafood, hamido, abuqir, sabrys, tellys tavern)

Taverna Kyclades

Iâ€™ve been coming to Taverna Kyclades for many years, and it continues to be one of our absolute favorite places. Not only because of the amazing food, but also because of the warm, family-like atmosphere that makes every visit special.

The food is always outstanding â€” fresh, flavorful, and authentically Greek. Every dish, from the seafood and fish to the salads and sides, is prepared with care and consistency. You can truly taste the quality and dedication in every bite.

But what truly makes Taverna Kyclades exceptional is the people who work there.
I want to give special recognition to Stefano, the manager, whose professionalism, kindness, and attention to detail shine through in everything he does. His leadership creates the welcoming environment that keeps customers coming back year after year.
Also, a big thank-you to Claire, always warm, elegant, and greeting everyone with a genuine smile; to Evangelis, who provides excellent, attentive service every single time; and to Peter, whose friendliness and great attitude make every visit even better.

We also want to thank all the staff members, from the kitchen to the servers and everyone working behind the scenes. Each of them contributes to the restaurantâ€™s success through their hard work, dedication, and positive energy.

And, of course, our sincere congratulations to the owner of Taverna Kyclades. Youâ€™ve done an outstanding job selecting such a talented, kind, and professional team. Itâ€™s clear that everyone here cares deeply about what they do â€” and thatâ€™s what makes this place so special.

After so many years of coming here, I can honestly say that Taverna Kyclades is much more than just a restaurant â€” itâ€™s a place where we always feel welcomed, appreciated, and part of the family.

Thank you to Stefano, Claire, Evangelis, Peter, and the entire team for so many years of excellence, warmth, and dedication. And congratulations to the owner for creating something truly exceptional.

With appreciation and gratitude,
NÃ©stor MelÃ©ndez & Family ğŸ’™ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·

The food was really overcooked. Service was great and fast, and prices were a bit high but reasonable. Sitting inside isnâ€™t a good idea..itâ€™s very loud. Itâ€™s better to wait for an outside table.

We got a lot of food, but we only really liked the salad and the saganaki. The Santorini shrimp was burnt, the fish was badly overcooked, and the fried calamari was pretty good. The octopus was also burnt. The waiter kept checking on us to see if everything was okay, but how was I supposed to tell him everything tasted burnt? Maybe it was just bad luck, but it definitely wasnâ€™t what we expected.
Octopus appetizer is great choice with the Greek salad.

My family and I had high expectations of this restaurant. First things first be prepared to wait at least an hour. Second, please beware of any items labeled MP on the menu, if you donâ€™t want any surprises, ask for the price in advance! We asked our server George, what the difference between the red and pink snapper were. He said, the difference is that pink snapper is bigger and feeds 2 to 3 people and the red is more for one person. He also insisted that the pink snapper is a very good choice, strongly insisting we would love it because he thinks itâ€™s the best fish and is a greek favorite, so we got it.

Fast forward to the bill and i was shocked that 1 item made up close to half of the bill. I didn't even order any drinks! There is no fish on Godâ€™s green earth worth $200 dollars but according to this restaurant and george, the pink snapper is worth just that. I could have gladly gone to Lugers, ordered a porterhouse and been much more satisfied. Extremely underwhelming.

If I must be honest everything else was ok, the salad was good, the lemon potatoes were good, the octopus was good, the greek sausages were good, the rice was good, the scallops were good, and the calamari was decent. Itâ€™s a shame, that one fish made this experience not feel worth it.

Iâ€™d also like to note that we sat outside and saw a flying cockroach on the wall behind us, so iâ€™m honestly not surprised at the most recent review which highlights such a horror. So unfortunate. Good luck to whomever decides to go here.

We always see this restaurant busy so we decided to have dinner with our family. The waiter was amicable but didnâ€™t mention price point when explaining the difference between a red snapper and a pink snapper. He recommended it to us and was super selling us on this fish. The price on the menu was marked as â€œMPâ€ which we thought okay it would be reasonable. When we got the bill, the pink snapper was $200! One fish was $200.

If youâ€™re thinking of having good seafood, please opt for HAMIDOS. The scallops, lobster tail and red snapper at Hamidoâ€™s is much better.

octopus and whiting were some of the best I've had, and the seafood pasta was delicious. You can tell they use high-quality ingredients, right down to the amazing olive oil on the table. The place has a great, bustling energy because it's always packed. Be prepared for a possible wait, but trust me, the meal you'll have makes it all worthwhile. Highly recommend!
Always great service
Small place over hyped. Needs to take a few lessons from another sea food spot this place is wack.

We had an amazing time at Taverna Kyclades in Astoria. The service was excellent and the atmosphere truly felt like Greek hospitality at its best. Our waitress Eleni was very attentive and made the evening extra special. As a Greek, I can say this is the real deal. Thank you for a wonderful night.

A neighborhood gem. Sitting outside was gorgeous and felt like I was part of the local community. The pink snapper was delicious and the portions are huge! Tried some local Greek wine and it was 10/10.

I love this restaurant. Yes itâ€™s always busy but for good reason. The quality of the food and service is really wonderful and the atmosphere is as well. Portions are beyond satisfying and that olive tapenade at the start of the mealâ€¦more please!!

The best seafood in Astoria. While it is a Greek Restaurant, they have a wide range of seafood options and I would suggest you venture outside of your typical chicken or gryo Greek food if you truly want to experience the quality here. Expect long wait times. There are no reservations. Always save some space for the free dessert!
Always the best

I took my niece to this restaurant! We had the best food ever!
P.S.Thank for the picture for a beautiful memory!

Food quality and staff attention are both solid here. This place exceeds what ratings can express. They served our meals fast and everything was tasty. The entire personnel displays authentic friendliness. I'll definitely return, impressive quality.
Food is delicious, i get the salad and whole fish was really good!
10/10 ğŸ‘ŒğŸ¼
Wonderful Greek restaurant in Astoria!

The food here is always fresh and tastyâ€”whether itâ€™s a salad or the fried fish, everythingâ€™s on point. The only thing is the wait can be long, but now they let you leave your number and text you when your tableâ€™s ready, which makes it way easier. Plus, the little dessert they bring out with the check is such a nice touch. This has been our go-to spot for a while, and it never disappoints.
Weâ€™ve been to many greek restaurants. This is by far the best one weâ€™ve been to the U.S.
A bit overpriced and staff should be less rude.

Taverna Kyclades never disappoints. The grilled octopus and lemon potatoes were perfect, and the seafood is clearly the star here. Portions are huge, service is quick, and the lively vibe makes it an easy favorite..

Pros : Everything cooked to perfection, pork souvlaki flavor and char was divine, salmon was cooked perfect tenderness. The tzaziki, bread, tapenade, wines, dessert all incredible. huge portions. Friendly efficient service.

Cons: on top of it being insanely loud there was also techno music playing, very overstimulating and impossible to have a conversation, salmon needed more flavor and was not deboned, which made eating it a chore.

I 100% will be back but maybe sit outside next time bc of the loud noise and techno
Great and absolutely delicious! Will always come with friends and family!

We have been wanting to go here for a very long time, but just never quite made it. That was a mistake! They don't take reservations so we waited for a while. It was fine the area has a lot to see and do, so we walked around. We had the village salad, Kyclades special (seafood platter),grilled chicken, rice, and potatoes. There was only 2 of us, and enough food to feed 4! Each bite was better than the next! All the food was fresh and delicious, and reasonable! We will be going back a lot! Great Greek food!ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡·

We visited Taverna Kyclades and had a wonderful experience. The service was impeccableâ€”every staff member, even those who werenâ€™t our primary server, made sure we had everything we needed.

For appetizers, we enjoyed crab cakes with fried zucchini. For dinner, my husband had a white fish stuffed with crab meat, while I had a pasta dish featuring five types of seafood: octopus, mussels, clams, scallops, and shrimp. Every bite was full of flavor, and the portions were incredibly generousâ€”we had to take half of our food home and enjoyed it for a couple more days!

Overall, the combination of excellent service, delicious food, and large portions made this a truly delightful dining experience.
everything was perfect

I just want to said that that today 9/13/2025 we went back to this restaurant because I love the first time we went there with my family from California.  But today the waitress was very bad took the order like he did not want to work you people are nobody, kind like discriminating us.  To bad .  I think I wonâ€™t go back there any more.  The second witress a girl was so nice.  Thank you un fortunately I did not get her name but never change the wait you do your work

I made a $350 Uber eats order for my father-in-lawâ€˜s birthday. What a disaster the lamb chops that came were overcooked and cold. This is something you really canâ€™t heat up. The lemon potatoes are hard. They added lettuce to the Greek salad to make it large that is unheard of Ask any Greek. The fish we ordered was the only thing we enjoyed ! The tzatziki sauce tasted lazy if thatâ€™s even a flavour. The pita came soggy! I wish we would have ordered pizza instead. Not worth the hype nor the money!!

Lively vibe,  EXCELLENT food, and great service.  The only thing I complain about is the bar.   I.always order a negroni, and it always comes out warm.  They dont stir and pour, they just pour, add ice, and serve.  Blasphemous if you ask me...  other than that,  tue place is SUPERB!!!

Don't waste your time and money!
To much nois for lunch or dinner!
This is definitely not a Greek style restaurant.
Everything was impeccable. Food, service, and atmosphere were all 10/10. There's a buzzbuy. I think his name is Jaime, but they should call him "El Maestro."
Delicious but a bit pricey, especially as many of the menu items are MP. Great service and fun environment make it a lovely experience. Will be back, especially for special occasions.
Our family favorite
Truly amazing. The food is great and they even gave me a free dessert. I would suggest their seafood pasta and stuffed clams

Taverna Kyclades is a must-visit for authentic Greek food in New York. The seafood is always fresh, flavorful, and cooked to perfection, especially the grilled octopus and lemon potatoes. Portions are generous, and every dish tastes homemade. The staff is friendly, attentive, and keeps the atmosphere warm and welcoming.
The real thing
Never misses. Top quality, always happy to be back!
Staff was top tier, food was amazing, made my quick trip to the area memorable

We had a wonderful experience. It was my first time here, but my friend had been here before. We didn't have to wait for a table but got seated right away which was a pleasant surprise. The food was great! I loved the spreads, the octopus, the baby shark, also all the sides, and the ginger mint mocktail. I am coming back to this Astoria gem!

Outstanding food, always waiting to go back! But this place gets so packed and you will consistently expect waits (even a Sunday after 6pm was quoted 45-min wait).

Local favorite- donâ€™t skip out on the appetizers! The dips are insanely good. Taverna Kyclades is pricey but worth it.

The place feels a bit packed inside, and we ended up waiting 45 minutes for a table for two on a Friday night, definitely a popular spot. The portions are generous. We tried the grilled octopus, which was flavorful and tender, though the spices were a bit overpowering. The seafood pasta was just okay, plenty of meat, but nothing particularly memorable. The lemon roasted potatoes leaned more boiled than roasted. On a brighter note, the free dessert was a delicious surprise.

Delicious Greek food in the heart of Astoria, Queens. Even though I liked the old location better, the new location is 2 blocks away from the old location. Waiting time is about 45 minutes and you canâ€™t reserve before you go. Itâ€™s difficult to find parking in the main street but you can find parking in the streets a little bit far from the restaurant. Staff are very helpful and friendly.

Nice bright blue and white colors. Plenty of inside and outside dining available.
The oysters were nice. The grilled octopus ğŸ™ was the highlight of my visit. I should have stopped with those two dishes.
I had the stuffed shrimp. Visually appealing.  Way too much stuffing on each shrimp, and the shrimp were chewey and overcooked.
Staff was friendly, and the service was good.
Ambiance is clean and fast paced, service on point and the 5 dishes ordered were melt in your mouth delicious. Loved the olive bread, olive spread and dessert all on the houseğŸ˜‹ğŸ‘Œâ€¦

Kyclades truly lives up to the hype. Every dish we tried was packed with flavorâ€”the octopus was incredibly tender, and both the dips and calamari were excellent. The only miss for me was the veggie chips; I normally love them, but these had an overpowering lemon taste and lacked any real veggie flavor. Still, everything else more than made up for it. The complimentary dessert is always a thoughtful touch, and our waitress was warm and attentive, which made the experience even better. Canâ€™t wait to come back!

A staple Greek spot in Astoria!
One of the most popular Greek restaurants in the areaâ€”and for good reason. The portions are huge, so come hungry or plan to share.

The food is simple, authentic, and really well doneâ€”no frills, just honest, flavorful Greek cooking.

It does get packed on weekends, so expect a wait, but itâ€™s definitely worth it.

ä½•ã‚’ã¨ã£ã¦ã‚‚ç´ æ™´ã‚‰ã—ã„ï¼å”¯ä¸€å•é¡Œãªã®ã¯ã€ä¸€çš¿ã®é‡ãŒå¤šã™ãã‚‹ã“ã¨â€¦ãµãŸã‚Šã§ãµãŸçš¿ã‚ªãƒ¼ãƒ€ãƒ¼ã—ã¾ã—ãŸãŒã€ã¨ã¦ã‚‚é£Ÿã¹ãã‚Œã¾ã›ã‚“ã§ã—ãŸã€‚

å¤–ã®ãƒ†ãƒ©ã‚¹å¸­ã‚‚æ°—æŒã¡ã‚ˆã•ãã†ï¼

We ordered several dishes and everything exceeded expectations!
â€¢	Spinach Pie â€“ The dough is absolutely amazingâ€”flaky and perfectly baked. Definitely a favorite and a great way to start.
â€¢	Fried Calamari â€“ Crispy, light, and not greasy at all. A classic done really well.
â€¢	Big Greek Salad â€“ Super fresh, generous portion, and full of flavor.
â€¢	Solo Fish â€“ Cooked beautifully, simple and high-quality.
â€¢	Lemon Potatoes â€“ Interesting and flavorful, but not something Iâ€™d order againâ€”just not quite for me.

Overall: big portions, delicious dishes, and noticeably high-quality ingredients. The packaging was beautiful, and the staff was very kind. From ordering to pickup, the whole process was smooth and pleasant. Highly recommend!

Taverna Kyclades is hands down one of the best Greek restaurants in NYC! The food is consistently fresh, flavorful, and generously portioned. The grilled octopus and whole branzino are absolute standoutsâ€”perfectly cooked and seasoned. The lemon potatoes and tzatziki are must-tries as well.

Service is friendly and efficient, even when the place is packed (which it often is). The staff clearly takes pride in what they do, and it shows. The atmosphere is lively and casual, with that authentic neighborhood charm that makes you feel right at home.

Be prepared for a bit of a wait, especially on weekendsâ€”but itâ€™s 100% worth it. A true gem for Greek cuisine lovers. Iâ€™ll definitely be back again and again!

I had dinner with my family at Taverna Kyclades in Astoria and overall, it was a quite good experience. The complimentary bread was warm and really tasty, a great start to the meal. I enjoyed the grilled calamari - it was delicious and perfectly cooked. The broiled fillet of sole was also a solid choice.

Rice, beets, and fried potatoes were just okay. The kyclades salad was mostly just lettuce, scallion, and feta with barely any olives. nothing special imo. The salmon steak tasted a bit too oily for my liking, though still decent.

We ended the meal with a complimentary galaktoboureko. It was quite sweet, but a lovely finish.

Absolutely worth the trip. Amazing food, wine, service and vibe. Got their assortment of dips, octopus, and this shrimp and tomato dish that was very good. The Greek salad is so simple but so delicious. Their portions are generous and they give you a dessert on the house. We also got their bottle of Caterina Sauvignon Blanc which was bright and slightly sweet. Highly recommend and will definitely go back.

Went back and tried their grilled clams and sea bass. Sea bass was very tender and I liked that there was a lot of meat to the fish. They didn't have the fried sardines so instead we tried their fried whiting which was a good alternative white fish.

Loved the food, very fresh and great variety! The place is very nice too inside and outside. The service not so great, very nice ppl but they spend more time talking to each other the Doing service, but the food and drinks is worth it.

â¸»

If youâ€™re in Astoria and craving authentic, delicious Greek food, Taverna Kyclades is a must-visit! The food is absolutely amazing â€” everything is cooked to perfection and full of flavor. The fried anchovies are especially mouth-watering â€” crispy, fresh, and packed with taste.

The staff is incredibly friendly and attentive, always making sure you feel welcome and taken care of. The atmosphere is warm, vibrant, and impeccably maintained â€” perfect for both casual meals and special occasions.

Highly recommend this spot for anyone who loves great food and great service. Canâ€™t wait to go back
Great greek resto. Great portions. My fish melted in my mouth. Small salad was like an XL size. Even the dessert was good.

Came here for dinner on a Saturday around 5:50. Thought we made a reservation online with some service called table 37 or something. Awesomeâ€¦not affiliated with restaurant. Was told one hour 20 minute wait for inside or outside could be seated immediately. Luckily I read about their blankets because they were needed!!! Service was just okay but the busser was killing it. All over our table with water, bread, boxing up leftovers, whatever. Food is plentiful and incredibly good. Had the village salad, spanikopita, chicken souvlaki and seafood pasta. All were absolutely delishhhhhh. Inside was jammed. Long line for the bathroom too!! Canâ€™t wait to go back! Easy walk from the N train. Excellent visit!

The food is very good, the portions are substantial, but the service from the servers is terrible. They're inattentive, they don't know how to recommend or serve wines, it seems like they're doing us a favor. The bussers provide impeccable customer service, and they alone are worth the tip.

This place was super cute!!! My friend and I just finished watching a movie and came in around 9:20pm for a table and it was still PACKED, especially outside. We ordered a small greek salad and the kyclades special (for 2) with a side of lemon pepper potato wedges. It was MORE than enough food for the both of us! We didn't care for the baked class, but we loved everything else. The seafood was super fresh. The lobster tail was perfectly cooked, first time having filet of sole. Now I like and will order that type of fish and the small greek salad was definitely enough for 3 or even 4 (shareable so everyone has some) highly recommend and would DEFINITELY come again. They also gave us a free dessert at the end which was phenomenal and a surprising touch. Overall 2 thumbs up and many yum yums
Highly recommend the grilled octopus! Ordered the whole branzino, grilled clams, and baby shark. Would come back to try the snapper/swordfish/chicken kebabs/or grilled calamari.
Fresh and delicious seafood with generous portions and friendly staff. It would be great to see more variety added to the lunch menu.
What a meal that was!!! Had the seafood platter, pork gyro platter and calamari. All were top notch great quality as I expected from the people that recommended the restaurant.

Best grilled fish restaurant in NY metropolitan area.
I do not miss grilled fish that I had in Santorini any more.
Try Grilled calamari not to mention about any grilled fish

The best Greek food in Astoria! The portions are generous, and everything is absolutely delicious. The cocktails are excellent as well. They donâ€™t take reservations, so itâ€™s walk-in onlyâ€”be prepared to wait, as it can take some time to get seated. However, the experience is well worth it for the amazing food and atmosphere!

I honestly donâ€™t understand the hype around this place. Aside from the lamb chops, thereâ€™s really nothing positive I can say about my lunch here. The octopus was mushy and hadnâ€™t been properly cleaned after boiling, and the swordfish came out undercooked and lacking seasoning. The service was both pushy and neglectful, itâ€™s like the really werenâ€™t even trying

Amazing! The food and service here are always top tier. Iâ€™ve tried so many Greek restaurants, but I keep coming back to Kyclades. The vibe, the hospitality, and the food are unmatched. Stefanos, Klea, and the whole team make you feel at home every single time. I even travel from Manhattan just to eat hereâ€”itâ€™s that worth it! Highly recommend to everyone.

This is  definitely a place to take a date or simply have a delicious authentic meal. The service is great and the food even better than the service.  Perfectly cooked in a timely manner.  It also comes with dessert, which was a plesant  surprise.  This place is definitely a second, third, fourth return, even though itâ€™s a small and a bit of a tight squeeze, itâ€™s well worth the trip.  Pay attention to the parking sign.
The wait maybe a little longer than usual, but keep an eye out for first come first serve at the bar as an alternative.

Only had 2 appetizers but I wish I had more! Food was delicious and high quality. Portions are large and fresh. I had the Greek salad and the grilled calamari. The salad was cold and very fresh, the grilled calamari was seasoned and cooked perfectly. Canâ€™t wait to go back and try the other dishes. I was looking at the other tableâ€™s orders and everything looked awesome.

What a delightful place.  It was super hot out but cool inside with I think just Fans.

Place just has such a good energy.  It felt like I'm just eating and hanging out.  A really nice place to come with a group.

The food was solid as well.

Very nice Greek restaurant. I went for lunch and the lunch specials are reasonably priced and come with one side. I chose grilled calamari and Swiss Chard.
Also comes with a grilled bread basket (3 pieces) and an olive tapenade.

Been going there for years because of the food and the atmosphere. Last week, for the first time ever Iâ€™ve noticed a bartender performing a Heimlich maneuver on a choking person.
The entire bar section was staring not knowing what to do and the bartender stayed calm and for a long time assisted the choking man eventually helping him get the stuck food out. I heard the person saying â€œMan, youâ€™ve saved my life!â€ after he got better.
It was very impressive and the bartender working that day deserves all the praise and a raise!

The food was really good and full of flavor, but itâ€™s definitely luxury pricing. They say the wait is about an hour, it definitely exceeds that. The place is packed and extremely loud, which makes it hard to relax or have a conversation. Good food, but not the easiest experience overall.

There are a lot of great places to eat on Ditmar and this is one of the anchors holding down the best corner inside or out. Had this place saved for over a year and finally made a specific trip - perfect stop headed to or leaving LGA - and everything was good. The vibe, atmosphere, people, hospitality - all family. We chose to seat at the bar because it was too hot outside and crowded inside. The bartender waited on us like she wasnâ€™t also juggling five other jobs.

The food was equally high quality. I was a bit thrown by what I thought were Manhattan prices til we got our double sized portions - two to-go bags please.

This is the kind of place you want to bring 20 people to. All family!
Great food. I was afraid the wait would take long but only took 10 minutes. Great customer service. The spinach pie, lamb chops, and ribeye were great

What a gem! The best Greek food I have ever had, and Iâ€™ve been to Greece!

The feta in the Greek salad is to die for.

We got lunch specials and we were surprised with a complimentary dessert!

It was very busy when we arrived but got sat very quickly. Everyone was friendly and all of the service staff looked like models.
Our server was very friendly. Just a little forgetful. Food came out at a respectable time. Nice and hot. Calamari was kind of bland.  Everything else was delicious. They also forgot our free dessert at the end but it didnâ€™t ruin our meal.

Came on a Sunday evening at 8pm and had to wait 30 minutes to get seated. We walked around the neighborhood a bit. Inside is packed tight very cozily. The service was really good and consistent and fast despite being super busy.
Food was very good! The octopus appetizer was probably the best octopus I've ever had - so soft and tender and juicy! We got the whole fish (black sea bass) deboned but there were still some bones but it was pretty decent. The scallop dish was a ton of scallops! What a delight. The lemon potatoes were very flavored and very soft. Also their Greek salad was somehow just so yummy.
At the end we got some traditional custard dessert. Overall we were very happy and satisfied. Thank you!

Food and service are amazing !! Iâ€™m here pretty often and the food is always amazing , I specially enjoy their grilled calamari , langostinos , sea food pasta and canâ€™t forget about the Kyclades special .

Taverna es un lugar lindo para cenar  el mesero creo que se llama Panagiotis el fue muy atento en el servicio me hizo sentir como en casa . Recomiendo los grill calamares  y grill clams es deliciosa la comida y el ambiente . Definitivamente volverÃ© vi un pescado que se miraba apetitoso.

The food was great. Even though it was small place and busy
, the service was great.
For the food we ordered 4 appetizers which was enough for 2 of us, but we saw people ordered couple of main courses. The good part was we ordered appetizers and find out we are full, so we were fine.
Food was delicious. We ordered grilled octopus, grilled calamari, and stuffed clams, my favorite one was calamari.
They offer free breads and dessert. Highly recommended
